summary: The Universal Right To Vote by Mail Act of 2025 aims to amend the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to allow all eligible voters to vote by mail in Federal elections. The bill prohibits states from imposing additional requirements on mail-in voting eligibility, except for deadlines. It mandates notification and opportunity to cure discrepancies or defects in mail-in ballots. The bill's provisions become effective for elections starting in 2026.
